Athletic development Webinar!!!

How to coach acrobatics in Artistic Swimming

Â 

To All PAQ National Federations:

Â 

PanAm Aquatics would like to invite the artistic swimming coaches in the Americas to a special webinar â€œHow to coach acrobatics in artistic swimmingâ€ on March 15th,Â 2021 at 11:00 am (ET/Miami time).Â 

Â 

Svitlana Saidova and Anastasiya PetrenkoÂ members of the FINA TASC Innovation Committee will be sharing their expertise in English.

Â 

Svitlana Saidova is a member of the FINA Technical Artistic Swimming Committee (TASC) and an outstanding Artistic Swimming (AS) coach. She is the Head Coach of the Ukrainian National Team and has worked closely with Diving and Acrobatics specialists in the Ukraine.

Â 

Anastasiya Petrenko is a former professional AS athlete and is now an AS FINA A Judge. She has collaborated in introducing the academic scope through her study on acrobatics as part of her masterâ€™s degree at the Kharkiv State Academy of Physical Culture (Ukraine).

Â 

Participants interested will need to register through this link:Â https://forms.gle/QmcWPZKT2SjNEv9K9by Tuesday March 8, 2022.

Â 

Please note that there are limited spaces available for this webinar; therefore, we encourage all interested participants to register as soon as possible.Â 

Â 

If you have any questions about the webinar, please contact Lisa Schott atÂ lschott@shaw.ca.Â 

If you have questions about registration and accessing the webinar, please contact contact Chris Tabri atÂ chris@panamaquatics.com.

https://forms.gle/puzmhfjT2cMPSCzq9

RECOMENDAÃ‡Ã•ES GERAIS PARA PARTIDA DA UCRÃ‚NIA:

Recomendamos a todos que tenham condiÃ§Ãµes de seguranÃ§a que procurem deixar a UcrÃ¢nia por meio de trens, em direÃ§Ã£o oeste. Ainda que com alguns atrasos, os trens tÃªm funcionado de forma bastante frequente e segura na maior parte do paÃ­s. Os horÃ¡rios muitas vezes sÃ³ sÃ£o confirmados de Ãºltima hora, assim que aconselhamos que se dirijam Ã s estaÃ§Ãµes centrais de trem quando nÃ£o houver toque de recolher e esperem os anÃºncios lÃ¡.

KIEV - A partir de hoje, segunda (28/2), o toque de recolher na cidade passa a valer como anteriormente, de 22:00 Ã s 8:00. Tendo isso em conta, a partir desta manhÃ£ os trens deverÃ£o funcionar normalmente durante o dia. #strongertogether ğŸ™ğŸ¼

Today marks the start of the third week since Ukraine was invaded, and tomorrow is my birthday. I'd like nothing more than for people to open their hearts to all those affected by the conflict, especially the ~2 million displaced Ukrainians, and to continue carrying that empathy forward into action and compassion through the next months and years as the world absorbs the fallout. 

Along with most of the world, I've been transfixed and heartsore these past weeks at Russia's war against Ukraine and the accompanying suffering. Like many others, I've donated to various efforts to provide aid to those impacted by the conflict. As both a thank-you to those who have already donated, and incentive for those who have yet to, I'll be donating a number of gems over the next months.

I'll start this off with a 4.2mm pair of sapphires, a heated blue Montana sapphire and golden yellow Umba sapphire. I cut these in 2020 and the buyer (thanks Wai!) has donated them back for this fundraiser.  Upcoming prizes may include: citrine and blue topaz cut in a sunflower design, sunstone cut in a design by Michiko Huynh called "Hope", yellow-blue parti sapphire. 

SHORT RULES FOR ENTRY - PLEASE USE THIS GOOGLE FORM: https://forms.gle/BSChm5CJZc9BVkVv8; will post a clickable link in my stories and stories highlight

1. Donate directly to one of the *humanitarian* charities listed in the form within the listed time frame.

2. Fill out this form with your contact information, and upload proof of donation.

3. For every $10 you donate, you'll get one drawing entry.

4. A winner will be randomly drawn from entries posted by Friday, March 11 2022, 11:59PM PST.

5. I will reach out to the winner at the provided contact info. If I don't hear back within 48h, I will redraw.

6. Free shipping within the United States; international buyers may be asked to cover postage.

Press Statement (for immediate release)

Mogadishu
28th March, 2022
 

Update on the Situation of Somali Nationals in Ukraine:
 
The Federal Government of Somalia is pleased to announce the release of three hundred and forty-eight displaced Somali nationals who have been stranded in Ukraine and along its borders including some due to lack of documentation. 
 
In addition, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of the Federal Republic of Somalia has facilitated the placement of sixty-five students in higher education institutions in Hungary â€” after registering their interest with the Ministry. 
 
The Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation urges Somali students registered to study in Ukraine and desire to continue higher education outside Ukraine to register by completing the form below.

Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation

Focal Point: Suad Nur
Email: suad.yusuf@mfa.gov.so

Form in English: https://forms.gle/VApiWkWk2PBuKlUF7 

Form in Somali: https://forms.gle/HVFBeorizRKXapL.K6

â€œSoft Encounter â€œ- teacher training on how to welcome children affected by trauma into the classroom.

In education nothing is as valuable as sharing experiences, knowledge and techniques to support each other in doing the best we can for each student.

Still I Rise has been working with children who have experienced trauma since the opening of MazÃ­ in Greece and therefore we have implemented effective techniques and approaches to train our teachers in this area.

Today we are witnessing thousands of refugees arriving in Italy because of the war in Ukraine, mostly women and children, and we are already seeing some schools begin to welcome them.

We felt that we could make a contribution to help schools and teachers to better manage this delicate moment.

This is how Soffice Incontro - Soft Encounter was born, an online training kit for all teachers who, in this historical moment but also on any occasion in their careers, find themselves having to make room in their classrooms for a new student who has experienced trauma and suffering.

This training material is meant to support teachers in doing their best for the student victim of trauma, welcoming them in a safe environment and being ready for sudden storms.

This is Soffice Incontro, an opportunity for professional growth and care for students.

To get access to the training material sign up here (in Italian only): https://forms.gle/vDhXcjDtrHmVXaz58 - Link also available in our stories

ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ Ğ”Ğ¾ Ğ·ÑƒÑÑ‚Ñ€Ñ–Ñ‡Ñ– Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ñ–Ñ— Ñ‚Ğ° Ğ±ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ¶Ñ–Ñ‚ÑŒ ÑĞµĞ±Ğµ!

As the atrocities inflicted on Ukraine continue to mount, aid still is needed for Ukrainian defenders and refugees. This will be my second fundraiser for humanitarian causes to Ukraine.

I'll be donating a number of gems over the next several months, in some cases with rough contributed by some of my colleagues. I'm hoping to hold one drawing per month, and this is the second.

Note 1! This fundraiser is open to donations backdated to the day after the first fundraising post. Donations to applicable charities between March 12, 2022 and April 15, 2022 will apply!

Note 2! If you have previously donated to a fundraiser and did not win, you will get one holdover entry to each new fundraiser per prior fundraiser entered. I realize not everybody is in a position to donate on an ongoing basis, and this is my attempt to be inclusive.

SHORT RULES FOR ENTRY - PLEASE USE THIS GOOGLE FORM: https://forms.gle/sU6qsTEirKYwvkUe7.  I will post a clickable link in my stories and stories highlight

1. Donate directly to one of the *humanitarian* charities listed in the form within the listed time frame.

2. Fill out this form with your contact information, and upload proof of donation.

3. For every $10 you donate, you'll get one entry.

4. TWO separate winners, one per gem, will be randomly drawn from entries posted by Friday, April 15, 2022, 11:59PM PST.

5. I will reach out to the winners at the provided contact info. If I don't hear back within 48h, I will redraw.

6. Free shipping within the United States; international buyers may be asked to cover postage.

April's prizes are an unheated silky light blue Montana sapphire hexagon (4.3mm, 0.66ct, included) and a golden yellow Mali garnet (4.8mm, 0.55ct, loupe clean). Since these are a little bit too different in size for a matched pair, these will be drawn separately to have two winners this month.
